Description:
The FHIR Patient resource defines demographics, care providers, and other administrative information about a person receiving care at a health organization.

Starting in May 2019, Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record:

  • FHIR ID
  • {IDType}|{ID}
  • SSN identifier
  • Given name, family name, and birthdate
  • Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

Starting in the November 2021 version of Epic (or in the August 2021 version with special updates), Patient.Search requests can use a patient identifier without specifying the ID Type. This includes FHIR IDs, SSNs, EPT IDs, and more. We still recommend including IDType for performance reasons.

This functionality may require a greater minimum data set than that you've tested with depending on the security policies and custom logic in place at an organization.

Starting in the May 2022 version of Epic, or February 2022 and November 2021 by special update, including patient search parameters in R4 FHIR is optional to make a request in a patient-facing context when using OAuth 2.0 authorization for the patient on whose behalf authorization to the system was granted.

address-city.Name: address-city
address-city.Description: The city for patient's home address.

address-postalcode.Name: address-postalcode
address-postalcode.Description: The postal code for patient's home address.

address-state.Name: address-state
address-state.Description: The state for the patient's home address.

birthdate.Name: birthdate
birthdate.Description: The patient's date of birth in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
birthdate.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

family.Name: family
family.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

gender.Name: gender
gender.Description: The patient's legal sex. Starting in the August 2021 version of Epic, the legal-sex parameter is preferred.
gender.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

given.Name: given
given.Description: The patient's given name. May include first and middle names.
given.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description:
The patient's identifier.

Starting in November 2018, this web service supports using ID and ID type combinations, such as Patient?identifier=MRN|202497.
identifier.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

legal-sex.Name: legal-sex
legal-sex.Description: The patient’s legal sex. Takes precedence over the gender search parameter. Available starting in the August 2021 version of Epic.
legal-sex.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

name.Name: name
name.Description: Any part of the patient's name. When discrete name parameters are used, such as family or given, this parameter is ignored.
name.Optional: Name can be used in place of providing both family and given.

own-name.Name: own-name
own-name.Description: The patient's own last name. Usually used in non-US names.
own-name.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

own-prefix.Name: own-prefix
own-prefix.Description: The patient's own prefix. Usually used in non-US names.
own-prefix.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

partner-name.Name: partner-name
partner-name.Description: The patient's spouse's last name. Usually used in non-US names.
partner-name.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

partner-prefix.Name: partner-prefix
partner-prefix.Description: The patient's spouse's prefix. Usually used in non-US names.
partner-prefix.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description: The patient's phone number or email.
telecom.Optional: Patient.Search requests require one of the following minimum data sets by default in order to match and return a patient record: FHIR ID; SSN; ID with or without an ID Type; Given name, family name, and birthdate; or Given name, family name, legal sex, and phone number/email

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

Patient.Name: Patient
Patient.Description: A single instance of a Patient FHIR resource.

active.Name: active
active.Description: Whether the patient record is active.

houseNumber.Name: extension
houseNumber.Description: For organizations in the Netherlands, this item represents the portion of a patient or contact’s address that is their house number.

streetName.Name: extension
streetName.Description: For organizations in the Netherlands, this item represents the portion of a patient or contact’s address that includes the name of their street.

birth location.Name: extension
birth location.Description: The newborn’s birth facility ID, name, address, and phone number.

birth sex.Name: extension
birth sex.Description:
The patient's sex assigned at birth.

This element is not returned for organizations in the Netherlands.

birthDate.Name: birthDate
birthDate.Description: The patient's date of birth in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

communication.Name: communication
communication.Description: A list of languages used to communicate with the patient, along with an indicator of which is preferred.

language.Name: language
language.Description: The patient's general language, onsite care language, and spoken language.

preferred.Name: preferred
preferred.Description: Whether the language is the patient's preferred language.

address.Name: address
address.Description:
The contact address.

For organizations in the Netherlands, this element represents an nl-core-address value.

name.Name: name
name.Description:
The contact’s preferred name. The system determines this from the contact’s linked patient record if available.

For organizations in the Netherlands, this element represents an nl-core-humanname value.

humannameAssemblyOrder.Name: extension
humannameAssemblyOrder.Description:
This extension is populated only for organizations in the Netherlands.

Name order for the contact. One of the following values:

  • NL1-Own Name
  • NL2-Partner Name
  • NL3-Partner Name followed by Maiden Name
  • NL4-Own Name followed by Partner Name

relationship.Name: relationship
relationship.Description:
For organizations in the Netherlands, either a Relationship (RelatieCodelijst) code system value or a role (RolCodelijst) code system value.

For all other organizations, this element always uses the v2 Contact Role code system with a code value of “C” (emergency contact) or “E” (employer).

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description:
Telephone numbers and email address for the contact.

For organizations in the Netherlands, this element represents an nl-core-contactpoint value.

deceasedBoolean.Name: deceasedBoolean
deceasedBoolean.Optional: deceasedDateTime is returned whenever available. If not available, deceasedBoolean will be returned.

deceasedDateTime.Name: deceasedDateTime
deceasedDateTime.Description: The date and time of death.
deceasedDateTime.Optional: deceasedDateTime is returned whenever available. If not available, deceasedBoolean will be returned.

ethnicity.Name: extension
ethnicity.Description:
The patient's ethnicity.

This element is not returned for organizations in the Netherlands.

gender-identity.Name: extension
gender-identity.Description: The patient’s gender identity. Available starting in the August 2021 version of Epic.

generalPractitioner.Name: generalPractitioner
generalPractitioner.Description: The patient's Primary Care Provider (PCP). Reference to a Practitioner resource.

legal-sex.Name: extension
legal-sex.Description:
The patient's race.

This element is not returned for organizations in the Netherlands.

managingOrganization.Name: managingOrganization
managingOrganization.Description: The patient’s primary service area. Reference to an Organization resource.

name.Name: name
name.Description:
The patient's name.

  • Starting in the May 2020 version of Epic, this element includes both the patient's "official" name, which is the patient's legal name, and the patient's "usual" name, which is the patient's preferred name.
    • If the patient does not have a preferred name defined in your system, the "usual" name also holds the patient's legal name.
    • In a patient-facing context, this web service always shows the patient's preferred name, unless a user has security point 'Only Show Legal Name'.
  • In the February 2020 version of Epic and earlier, this element returns only the patient's legal name with a use code of "usual".
  • Starting in the November 2020 version of Epic (August 2020, May 2020, and February 2020 with special updates), this element can include the patient’s “old” names, which are aliases or names no longer in use, in addition to the “official” and “usual” names.
  • Starting in the August 2021 version of Epic, names with a use code of “old” can be returned with discrete name elements, such as “given” or “family”.

family.Name: family
family.Description:
The patient's family (last) name.

Starting in the August 2021 version of Epic, can contain a data-absent-reason extension with a value of "unknown" if the patient has an alias that cannot be returned as discrete elements.

given.Name: given
given.Description: The patient's given name. May include first and middle names.

suffix.Name: suffix
suffix.Description: The patient's name suffix. Acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc.

text.Name: text
text.Description: The patient's full name as a string.

use.Name: use
use.Description: The purpose of the name. May be "official", "usual", or "old". See the name parameter for full details on use.

patient-preferred-provider-language.Name: extension
patient-preferred-provider-language.Description: The patient's preferred provider language, used for scheduling.

patient-preferred-provider-sex.Name: extension
patient-preferred-provider-sex.Description: The patient's preferred provider sex, used for scheduling.

patient-type.Name: extension
patient-type.Description: The type of patient, such as Confidential or Employee.

race.Name: extension
race.Description:
The patient's race.

This element is not returned for organizations in the Netherlands.

sex-for-clinical-use.Name: extension
sex-for-clinical-use.Description: The patient’s sex for clinical decision making. This is an Epic-calculated value. If Ambiguous, the extension is not included. Available starting in the August 2021 version of Epic.

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description: Telephone numbers and email addresses for the patient, along with their use (e.g. home, work)

system.Name: system
system.Description:
The type of telecom. Potential values are:

  • email
  • phone

use.Name: use
use.Description:
If the telecom entry is a phone number, possible values are:

  • home
  • mobile
  • work

value.Name: value
value.Description: Value of the telecom method. May be an email address or phone number.
